DOC.brief_summary: Hypothesis To investigate whether telephone counsel nurse educator clinic visit particular emphasis adherence medication lifestyle modification patient coronary heart disease diabetes reduce mortality hospitalisation rate due cardiovascular event compare usual clinic-based care .
DOC.brief_title: Telephone Intervention Patients With Acute Coronary Syndrome ( ACS ) Diabetes
DOC.detailed_description: Study-design A 2-year multicentre , randomise control open study involve 5 HA hospital Hong Kong . Subjects method One thousand two hundred sixteen patient admit hospital principle diagnosis coronary heart disease know newly confirm diabetes oral glucose tolerance test enrol . Patients intervention arm ( n=608 ) receive telephone intervention clinic visit diabetes nurse educator use structure counselling tool particular emphasis adherence lifestyle modification medication well self-monitoring blood glucose , blood pressure body weight . Patients control group ( n=608 ) receive telephone intervention . Both group follow usual medical team hospital upon discharge . Clinical endpoint Primary endpoint composite death and/or cardiovascular related hospitalisation . Secondary endpoint include hospitalisation due cardiovascular event , number hospital admission , total number day hospital stay attendance Accident Emergency Department .
